results.title: Emotional aspects of pregnancy
results.creator_credit: Sally Marschall, Phillip Koch and Joshua Productions
results.brief_description: Prepares the expectant mother and father for emotional changes, highlighting the experiences of two expectant couples and of one single expectant mother. During pregnancy, the woman’s feelings become more intense. The man’s feelings change also. Relationships with family and friends take on new dimensions. Both need reassurance that they are loved.

results.title: Emoh ruo
results.creator_credit: Denny Lawrence, David Elfick, Palm Beach Pictures and UAA Films
results.brief_description: Australian satire about the Tunkley family and the trouble they encounter when they buy their first home. Stars Joy Smithers and Martin Sacks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denny Lawrence, David Elfick, Palm Beach Pictures and UAA Films

results.title: Emmet Otter's jug-band Christmas
results.brief_description: Emmet Otter and his mother Alice both enter a talent contest in an effort to win $50 and buy each other the ‘best’ Christmas present. Entering involve sacrifices, pawning their departed father’s tool kit and drilling a hole in Alice’s washboard to make a musical instrument. Both Alice and Emmet perform well but not good enough to beat the out of town contestants,’The Riverbottom Nightmares’. Initially it seems that their efforts have been futile but when they combine their talents they discover that they have the best Christmas ever. Based on the book by Russell and Lillian Hoban.

results.title: Emmanuelle
results.brief_description: Emmanuelle is the story of a young French girl (played by Sylvia Kristel), and her transformation from shy coquette to sensuous, worldly woman through a series of erotic encounters with both friends and strangers. Newly married, Emmanuelle flys to Bangkok to join her husband, Jean, but soon succumbs to the boredom of her circumstances. When Jean encourages her to actively seek out new sexual adventures with men and women, she is momentarily taken aback. However, after being pursued by the nymphette, Marie-Ange, and seduced by her friend, Ariane, after a game of squash, Emmanuelle decides to seek out Bee (Marika Green), an archaeologist working in Bangkok, for friendship and fun. The consequences of this encounter convince her to meet with the elderly Mario (Alain Cuny), who offers to further her sexual education, promising her that he will free her from a life of moral slavery. Under his expert tuition, Emmanuelle is finally able to throw off the last vestiges of guilt, and abandon herself to the pleasures of free, unbounded sex. Advertised as “X was never like this!”, the film was a smash hit around the world. “Emmanuelle”, the first feature film by Dutch director, Just Jaekin, is the highest grossing French film of all-time, spawning six official sequels, numerous “copycat” sequels, and a French TV show. Based on the banned, scandalous 1957 novel “Emmanuelle: The Joys of a Woman”, by Emmanuelle Arsan.

results.title: Emma (Paltrow)
results.creator_credit: Douglas McGrath, Patrick Cassavetti, Steven Haft, Haft Entertainment and Matchmaker Films
results.brief_description: This 1996 film version of Jane Austen’s novel stars Gwyneth Paltrow as the clever, rich “heroine” of the film who thinks a little too highly of herself, and entertains herself by meddling in the affairs of others. The destructive potential of Emma’s fantasies is best shown in her treatment of her protegee Harriet Smith (Toni Collette). At the start of the film, a match is all but made between Harriet and farmer Robert Martin. Emma, however teaches her to aspire to better things, arranging a match between Harriet and Mr.Elton (Alan Cumming). When this fails (because he is in love with Emma), she urges Harriet to look elsewhere. And when Harriet announces that she has fallen in love with another man, Emma imagines the man to be Frank Churchill (Ewan McGregor). The self-destructiveness of her imaginings is only apparent to her when she finally realises that the man in question is Mr.Knightley (Jeremy Northam), with whom she realises no one can be with but herself! In describing the mischievous schemes and eventual humbling of Emma, the film loses no opportunity to poke ironic fun at the society and social mores of the day.

results.title: Emma
results.creator_credit: John Glenister, Martin Lisemore and BBC
results.brief_description: Often insensitive, but ever well-meaning, Emma Woodhouse, one of the most beloved of Jane Austen’s heroines, turns her hand at matchmaking the local vicar Mr. Elton with her friend Harriet Smith. Despite the disastrous consequences, it is Emma herself who finds happiness with long time friend Mr. Knightley, one of the few people who acts as the voice of reason and restraint. This splendid BBC dramatisation brings to life all the wit and humour of the novel. Stars Doran Godwin and John Carson as Emma and Mr. Knightley with Mollie Sugden and Fiona Walker.

results.title: Emily Bronte's Wuthering Heights
results.creator_credit: Peter Kosminsky, Mary Selway and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: This colorful adaptation of Emily Bronte’s timeless novel follows the structure of the original story. Cathy and Heathcliff are childhood sweathearts whose love in adulthood is thwarted by the social conditions and expectations surrounding them. Ralph Fiennes and Juliette Binoche are beautiful to watch although they don’t catch the intensity of the doomed lovers of Wuthering Heights. The Yorkshire moors make a picturesque backdrop and Ryuichi Sakamoto supplies beautiful music.

results.title: Emerging
results.creator_credit: Michael Mc Farland and Amaranth Productions
results.brief_description: Endeavours to create a spectrum of moods and feelings by showing the continuing evolution of public awareness in attitudes towards disabled people, the progress which is being made in rehabilitation technology and architectural design and the many achievements disabled people are capable of.

results.title: Emergency obstetrics
results.creator_credit: Richard Scott, Pyramid Films and Medi-Cine
results.brief_description: Shows emergency medical technicians how to assist in emergency childbirth. Demonstrates step-by-step procedures showing two live births and the critical situation of a prolapsed umbilical cord. Narrated by Lynne Littman.
